entry.title: The Ark case for CTV
entry.summary:
In the process of communication within a network or system where all participants are actively involved in both sending and receiving messages, it's essential to recognize that each participant plays dual roles simultaneously. This mechanism ensures that everyone involved is not only responsible for transmitting their own information but also for receiving inputs from others. The inherent requirement for participants to be present for both sending and receiving actions facilitates a more interactive and engaged communication environment.
This dynamic underscores the importance of active participation and engagement in systems designed for efficient exchange of information. By necessitating the presence of all individuals for both aspects of communication, it ensures a more robust and synchronous exchange of data, enhancing the overall effectiveness of the communication process.
